comments.author: John McCosker
comments.comment:
Please change text from:
Leave request cannot be approved as few leave plans are undecided
to:
Leave request cannot be approved as there are undecided leave plans

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment: "as some" instead if "as few"

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment:
I have changed the message for approval rejected, approval undecided and denied undecided in the similar lines Following are the new messages. I thinks following messages makes more sense:
Leave request cannot be approved as all leave plans are rejected for the leave request
Leave request cannot be approved as there are some undecided leave plans for the leave request
Leave request cannot be denied as there are some undecided leave plans for the leave request

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: Messages changed as described above

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment: again "as some" instead of "as few"

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: Messages changed as described above

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment:
Would it not be more efficient to check if any of the selected leave plans had a status other than rejected and as soon as we find one return false
similar to your undecided check below

comments.author: Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: Yes, your suggestion is more efficiient. I changed the code as suggested by you.Tested the functionality as well, it works fine

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment:
avoid test methods names like
testSomethingSomethingSomething
the test is a given so not neeed. Should be describing method under test, conditions ,
e.g.
testArreAllSelectedLeavePlanRejected_With_No_RejectedPlans
should be
areAllSelectedLeavePlanRejected_returnsFalse_whenLeaveRequestsHasLeavePlansWhichAreNotRejected
oir
whenLeaveRequestHasUndecidedLeavePlans_areAllSelectedLeavePlanRejected_returnsFalse
it doesnt matter how verbose the name is aslong as its clear whats being tested.
Just looking at LeaveRequestAdjucationApprovalValidatorTest below is a much better example

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment:
Extract strings to private constant.
Where's the source of the string value? In an open field or in a closed one, like an enum? If an enum, is not possible to compare it to the enum, because comparing longs is much more performance than comparing Strings.
